forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle after 11pm. Mostly clear, with a low around 60. West wind 12 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle before 11am. Sunny. High near 72, with temperatures falling to around 70 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 10 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
As the sun sinks beneath the horizon, its farewell casts a soft glow over Downtown San Francisco, setting the stage for a night filled with quiet anticipation. The promise of a slight drizzle lingers, a mere whisper of moisture that is likely to float in after 11 PM. With a balmy low around 60 degrees, the cool evening air is complemented by a west wind that dances through the streets at a brisk pace, reminding everyone just how vibrant an autumn evening can be.

Tomorrow heralds a gentle warmth, with the day unfurling into clear skies. Although the possibility of early morning drizzle exists, the sun is set to illuminate the city, warming it up to near 72 degrees, before the afternoon beckons cooler breaths of air. It will be a day of alternating warmth and cool, urging one to dress in layers—a light sweater over a t-shirt, perfect for navigating the city's shifting temperatures. The serene clarity of the day invites a walk through Golden Gate Park, perhaps a leisurely sit at a café in the Mission, sipping coffee while observing the simple ebb and flow of everyday life. The marine layer may blankedly roll in, creating ethereal moments of contemplation where fog hugs the coastline. 

So prepare for lovely ventures outdoors, but don’t forget that slight chill in the air. The evening's glimmer promises a fascinating transition into the day ahead, full of possibilities.
